meanings.definition: Existing in name only, not real or actual.
meanings.sent1: The price of the item was nominal, but the quality was excellent.
meanings.sent2: She paid a nominal fee to join the club.
meanings.sent3: The king's nominal power was overshadowed by the council's influence.
meanings.sent4: Her title of 'Queen of the Fairies' was nominal, as she had no magical abilities.
meanings.sent5: The nominal leader of the group was actually just a figurehead.

meanings.definition: Very small in amount or value.
meanings.sent1: The increase in salary was nominal, barely enough to cover the cost of living.
meanings.sent2: He received a nominal sum for his contribution to the project.
meanings.sent3: The tiny plant had only a nominal amount of leaves.
meanings.sent4: The impact of his words was nominal, hardly noticed by the audience.
meanings.sent5: The nominal tip left on the table was insulting to the waiter.

meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or constituting a name.
meanings.sent1: The nominal value of the company was printed on the stock certificate.
meanings.sent2: She received a nominal award for her years of service.
meanings.sent3: The nominal list of attendees did not include all the guests who showed up.
meanings.sent4: The nominal title of 'President' was just for show, with no real authority.
meanings.sent5: The nominal inscription on the trophy read 'Best in Show'.
